title: Trump farewell: 'We did what we came here to do'
description: Donald Trump touted his achievements during his last formal address as president.

title: Even a pandemic won't stop Kathleen's 105th birthday
description: Kathleen celebrated her milestone birthday at her care home in Exeter, where staff and residents had a party.

title: Covid-19: Mortician says deaths have taken a toll
description: Senior mortician Hannah Leahy says the level of Covid fatalities is taking its toll on staff the Royal London Hospital.

title: Football in Fortnite: New sport collaboration is 'just the start'
description: The game announces a collaboration with some of the world's biggest football clubs.

title: Essex academic's imposter 'copied work and tattoos'
description: A British lecturer says a student in the US copied his work and adopted his identity at conferences.

title: US historians on what Donald Trump's legacy will be
description: The last four years have been a whirlwind - we asked the experts to break down Trump's key moments.

title: Covid: Positive antibody tests doubled since autumn
description: Some 10% of the UK population is showing signs of recent infection, a doubling since October, says ONS.

title: Storm Christoph: Flood warnings in parts of England
description: A "major incident" is declared in South Yorkshire as rain is set to batter northern and central England.

title: Covid: Health secretary Matt Hancock self-isolating after app alert
description: Matt Hancock says he will stay home and urged others to do the same if "pinged" by the app.

title: ONA: Vegan restaurant becomes first in France to get Michelin star
description: ONA in the south-west is the first eatery serving plant-based food to win a prestigious Michelin star.

title: Trump decree on Covid visiting rules rebuffed as he enters final day
description: Joe Biden will reverse Donald Trump's latest decree on Covid travel, as Wednesday's inauguration looms.

title: Conservative rebel MPs pressure government over genocide clause
description: Tory MPs want Parliament to debate ending trade deals with countries deemed responsible for genocide.

title: Covid: Cash refusal 'creeping into UK economy'
description: A survey by consumer group Which? raises concerns over coronavirus leading to more cashless stores.

title: Manchester Arena attack: Man tried to comfort Saffie-Rose Roussos
description: Paul Reid was the first person to reach Saffie-Rose Roussos, eight, after the bomb was detonated.

title: India stun Australia to clinch one of the greatest Test series victories
description: India pull off an astonishing run-chase to inflict Australia's first defeat at the Gabba since 1988 and take one of the all-time great series.

title: Two players test positive for Covid-19 before Australian Open
description: The news comes amid a growing row over quarantine rules for the players ahead of the tournament.

title: Peaky Blinders to end after sixth series
description: BBC crime drama "will continue in another form” beyond TV series, says creator.

title: Olivier Duhamel: French incest allegations prompt victims to speak out
description: A sex abuse case involving a well-known intellectual sparked a deluge of testimonies by victims of abuse.

title: Covid-19: 'Grave concern' over court backlog, and Biden keeps Covid travel bans
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Tuesday morning.

title: 'Bruce's way' starts with defeat - but are there signs it could be the right way?
description: Newcastle boss Steve Bruce has declared he will do things "my way" from now on - but are there signs it is the right way?

title: 'I'd love to play in The Hundred' - Taylor on 'maybe' making a comeback
description: Former England wicketkeeper Sarah Taylor on "maybe" making a comeback, playing in The Hundred and her brush with men's cricket.

title: Karen Carney column: Why Lampard must be given time at Chelsea
description: In her latest BBC Sport column, Karen Carney discusses why Chelsea should give Frank Lampard more time to build a winning mentality at the club.

title: Newspaper headlines: Jab complacency fears and smart motorway inquest
description: Tuesday's front pages report fears that millions of people could ignore Covid rules once they are vaccinated.

title: Johnson 'glad' to see Trump go, says ex-Civil Service head Lord Sedwill
description: People who say Boris Johnson does not want Joe Biden as president are "mistaken", says Lord Sedwill.

title: First Dates: Channel 4 series will feel 'more like real life'
description: The latest daters are in unfamiliar surroundings as the Channel 4 series moves to a new restaurant.

title: Why Iran’s nuclear facilities are still vulnerable to attack
description: Putting sites underground does not mean they're beyond the reach of those who want them scuppered.

title: Italy smoking: Want to light up in Milan? Not any more, you can't
description: Smoking within 10m (30ft) of others is no longer allowed in parks, play areas, bus and tram stops.

title: The Hong Kong migrants fleeing to start new lives in the UK
description: A new visa will give 5.4m Hong Kong residents the right to resettle in Britain. How many will leave?

title: How to investigate a firm with 60 million documents
description: Artificial intelligence helped investigators in a daunting examination of Airbus's business.

title: 'My boss made me come to work and I caught Covid'
description: Despite the risks, people say they are being asked to work on site when they could do it from home.

title: Depop: 'I felt so violated when my account was hacked'
description: Hackers are selling Depop app account details on the dark web for as little as 77p each online.

title: Conquering K2 in winter 'together'
description: The BBC speaks to Nirmal Purja, from the team of the first climbers to reach the K2 summit in winter.

title: Royal Papworth Hospital proposal by man who spent Christmas alone
description: Family members watched online as Jordan got engaged to his partner, with the help of nurses.
